A regulation made before December 31, 2012 under this section in relation to section 1.1 may be made retroactive to May 1, 2012 or a later date, and if made retroactive is deemed to have come into force on the specified date.

A regulation made before July 1, 2014 under this section in relation to section 8.1, 14 (2) (g) or 39.1 may be made retroactive to January 1, 2014 or a later date, and if made retroactive is deemed to have come into force on the specified date.
[Repealed 2012-8-16.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — imposition of tax on purchase

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a purchaser buys fuel before July 1, 2008 and the purchaser receives delivery of the fuel on or after that date, the purchaser must pay to the government tax on the fuel at the rate for that type of fuel set out in the column of the Table in Schedule 1 that applies for the period of time in which the purchaser receives delivery.

If a retail dealer sells a fuel to a purchaser before July 1, 2008 and the purchaser receives delivery of the fuel on or after that date, the retail dealer must collect tax on that fuel at the rate for that type of fuel set out in the column of the Table in Schedule 1 that applies for the period of time in which the purchaser receives delivery.

A reference to "purchaser" in this section does not include a person who is a registered consumer with respect to the type or subcategory of a type of fuel specified on that person's registered consumer certificate.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — imposition of tax on use

bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), a person who uses a fuel on or after July 1, 2008 is not required to pay tax on the use of the fuel under section 11, if tax was paid on the fuel under section 86 or if the fuel was, before that date,
within the meaning of section 8, 9 or 10.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: bought and received,
transferred, or
brought into British Columbia

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a registered consumer who uses fuel on or after July 1, 2008 if the fuel used is the type or subcategory of a type specified on the registered consumer certificate of the registered consumer.

bcl:text: Section 11 applies to a registered consumer referred to in subsection (2) even if the fuel used by the registered consumer was, before July 1, 2008,
within the meaning of section 8, 9 or 10.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: bought and received,
transferred, or
brought into British Columbia

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — change in rate of tax and payment of security

bcl:text: If
the deputy collector or retail dealer must provide to the director by August 15, 2008 an inventory of that fuel, in accordance with the instructions of the director.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a deputy collector or retail dealer owns fuel on July 1, 2008, and
security would have been payable by the deputy collector or retail dealer if this Act were in force on the date the deputy collector or retail dealer bought the fuel,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (1), if a retail dealer entered into an agreement to sell fuel to a purchaser before July 1, 2008 and the purchaser has not received delivery of the fuel before July 1, 2008, the retail dealer is deemed to own the fuel.
For the purposes of subsection (1), a deputy collector or retail dealer, as the case may be, who meets the requirements of paragraphs (a) to (c), is deemed to own a fuel on July 1, 2008 if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the deputy collector or retail dealer has entered into an agreement to buy the fuel and the agreement provides that the deputy collector or retail dealer owns the fuel on July 1, 2008,
the deputy collector or the retail dealer has not received delivery of the fuel before July 1, 2008, and
the deputy collector or the retail dealer has not entered into an agreement with another person that provides that the other person owns the fuel on July 1, 2008.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to the regulations, the director may pay an allowance of $250 to a deputy collector or retail dealer who provided an inventory by August 15, 2008 under subsection (1).

Subject to the regulations, a deputy collector or retail dealer who is required to provide an inventory under subsection (1) must pay to the director by August 15, 2008 the amount of security on fuel included in the inventory equal to the tax that would be collectable if the fuel were sold to a purchaser on July 1, 2008.

Subject to subsection (2), if, on or after July 1, 2008 a purchaser takes delivery of fuel and pays to the government tax on the purchase of the fuel under this Act, the director, on application and on receipt of evidence satisfactory to the director, must pay to the purchaser, from the consolidated revenue fund, a refund of tax paid if the delivery is taken, under a fixed-price contract made by the purchaser with the seller before February 20, 2008, in respect of a quantity of fuel that does not exceed the quantity specified in the contract.
No refund is to be paid under subsection (1) if the purchaser

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is entitled, under the fixed-price contract, to recover the tax on the fuel imposed under this Act, or
receives delivery of the fuel after June 30, 2009.

bcl:text.#text: Effective on July 1, 2008, a person who, immediately before that date, was a collector appointed under section 28 (1) or 32 (2) of the , as those provisions read before the date this Act receives Royal Assent, is deemed to be appointed as a collector under section 28 of the , as enacted by this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An appointment deemed to be made under subsection (1) has a term that ends on the date that is the earliest of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the end of the day on December 31, 2008;

bcl:text.#text: the date the deemed appointment as a collector is suspended or cancelled under the , as amended by this Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date the person is appointed as a collector under section 28, as enacted by this Act.

bcl:text.#text: If the appointment of a person as a collector under section 28 (1) or 32 (2) of the , as those provisions read before the date this Act receives Royal Assent, is subject to terms and conditions, the deemed appointment of a person as a collector under subsection (1) of this section is subject to the same terms and conditions, unless the director specifies different terms and conditions.

If the appointment of a person as a collector under section 28 (1) or 32 (2) of the , as those provisions read before the date this Act receives Royal Assent, is not subject to terms and conditions, the director may specify terms and conditions for the deemed appointment of the person as a collector under subsection (1) of this section.

If, at the time section 110 of this Act comes into force, a person was appointed as a collector under section 29 (2) of the , as it read before the coming into force of section 110, the person is deemed to be authorized to sell a substance as a type of fuel in circumstances in which the person bought the substance as another type of fuel, subject to the conditions the director specifies, if any, until the date that is earliest of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the end of the day on December 31, 2008;
the date the authorization is suspended or cancelled by the director;
the date the person is

bcl:text.#text: appointed as a collector under section 28 of the , as enacted by this Act, or
authorized by the director, under section 29 (2) of the , as enacted by this Act.

Effective on July 1, 2008, a person who, immediately before that date, was a registered consumer, as defined in section 1 of the  as it read before the coming into force of section 98 of this Act, is deemed to have been issued a registered consumer certificate under section 37 of the , as enacted by this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The certificate deemed to be issued under subsection (1) has a term that ends on the date that is the earliest of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the end of the day on December 31, 2008;

bcl:text.#text: the date the deemed registered consumer certificate is suspended or cancelled under the , as amended by this Act;
the date the person is issued a registered consumer certificate under section 37 of the , as enacted by this Act.

If a person holds a registered consumer certificate under section 37 of the , as it read before the coming into force of section 118 of this Act, that is subject to terms and conditions, the deemed registered consumer certificate under subsection (1) is subject to the same terms and conditions, unless the director specifies different terms and conditions.

If a registered consumer certificate issued to a person under section 37 the , as it read before the coming into force of section 118 of this Act, is not subject to terms and conditions, the director may specify terms and conditions for the registered consumer certificate that is deemed to be issued to the person under subsection (1).

bcl:section.bcl:text: If a retail dealer sells fuel to a licensed carrier before July 1, 2008 and the licensed carrier receives delivery of the fuel on or after that date, the retail dealer must collect tax on that fuel at the rate that applies at the time the licensed carrier receives delivery of the fuel.

bcl:text.#text: The , as it read immediately before the date this Act receives Royal Assent, continues to apply to

bcl:text: before July 1, 2008.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an application for a refund received by the director under that Act, and
an action commenced under that Act

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — penalty for failure to remit tax or pay security

bcl:text.#text: The director may impose a penalty on a person referred to in section 45 of the , as amended by section 128 of this Act, in respect of a failure by the person to remit tax or pay security before July 1, 2008.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this Schedule:

bcl:text.#text: means a substance suitable to power an aircraft that is not propelled by a turbine;
means a substance that is made up of mono-alkyl esters of long chain fatty acids derived from plant or animal matter;
means an internal combustion engine, including a stationary engine, in which internal combustion is initiated by compression;
means a mixture of two or more of ethane, propane, butane or pentanes plus, whether in gaseous or liquid form, that

bcl:text: but does not include a mixture of ethane, propane, butane or pentanes plus that is created after the ethane, propane, butane or pentanes plus have been processed into separate identifiable fuels and then remixed into a blend of one or more of the fuels;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is obtained from the processing of natural gas or crude oil, and
has never been processed into separate identifiable fuels,

bcl:text.#text: means a substance suitable for generating power by means of an internal combustion engine, other than a diesel engine, but does not include any other fuel;
means a substance that is a distillate or a residual of crude oil and that has a viscosity of greater than 14 centistokes at 50C;
means bituminous coal and any other coal with a heating value greater than 27 000 kJ per kg;
means a substance that is made from plant or animal matter using a hydrogenation process;
includes a turbine engine that generates power by the use of fuel;
means a substance suitable to power an aircraft that is propelled by a turbine;
means a substance that is

bcl:text: and is suitable
but does not include butane, ethane, gas liquids, jet fuel, kerosene, naphtha, propane, pentanes plus or refinery gas;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a distillate of crude oil that has a viscosity of not greater than 14 centistokes at 50°C,
renewable diesel fuel, or
a combination of substances including the substances referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b),
for generating power by means of a diesel engine, or
for use in a furnace, boiler or open flame burner,

bcl:text.#text: means sub-bituminous coal and any other coal with a heating value up to and including 27 000 kJ per kg;
means natural gas, whether or not the natural gas

bcl:text: but does not include refinery gas;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: occurs naturally or results from processing, or

bcl:text.#text: means pentane, heavier hydrocarbons or a combination of both, but does not include any other fuel;
means gas for use in an oil refinery that is produced as a result of distillation, cracking, reforming or other oil refining processes;
means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: biodiesel fuel, or
hydrogenated-derived renewable diesel fuel;

bcl:text.#text: means, in the case of
a gas, a temperature of 15C and an atmospheric pressure of 101.325 kPa, and
a liquid, a temperature of 15C.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For calculating the amount of tax payable for a fuel set out in column 2 of the Table, when the rate of tax is based on litres, the rate of tax must be multiplied by the amount of liquids or gaseous fuels measured in litres at standard reference conditions.

For calculating the amount of tax payable for a fuel set out in column 2 of the Table, when the rate of tax is based on cubic metres, the rate of tax must be multiplied by the amount of liquids or gaseous fuels measured in cubic metres at standard reference conditions.
For the purpose of calculating the amount of tax payable for a fuel set out in column 2 of the Table,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: gas liquids are a separate fuel when the gas liquids are separated from natural gas or crude oil for the first time as a result of processing and have not been

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: separated into ethane, propane, butane or pentanes plus as a result of processing, or
separated into ethane, propane, butane or pentanes plus as a result of processing and then remixed into a blend of one or more of the fuels, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: ethane, propane, butane and pentanes plus are separate fuels when they have been processed and are identifiable as separate fuels as a result of processing.
